viewerModes.description: Continuous slow rotation around the primary object, easing in/out; PRM-aware with fade-only variant.
No motion; subtle filmic drift in lighting only, or full freeze for strict PRM.
Exploded anatomical view showing relationships between components (e.g. implant, abutment, crown, bone).
Keyframe-only exploded views stepped via UI controls instead of auto-animation.
Side-by-side or scrubber-based comparison between before and after states.
Step-through comparison: discrete before/after toggle, no animated scrub.
Overlay lines, guides, or mockups on top of base geometry or imported photo (DSD, surgical guides).
Macro zoom into a single tooth or implant site with guided camera framing.
Frames entire arch for aligners, braces, and full-arch implant restorations.
Frames lips-to-teeth band for smile design and veneer reveal shots.
Interactive CBCT slice mode with axial/coronal/sagittal controls and implant overlays.
Non-animated sequence of pre-defined CBCT slice views with next/previous buttons.
Slow orbit of a semi-transparent volume rendering (jaw segments, CBCT). PRM-aware.
Step-through sequence of treatment stages (e.g. aligner steps).
Lab-bench framing with small contextual objects (instruments, trays) kept static around hero.
